an4.60:4.1: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha,
an4.60:4.2: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an4.60:5.1: “Householder, when a noble disciple does four things they are practicing appropriately for a layperson, which brings fame and leads to heaven.
an4.60:5.3: It’s when a noble disciple serves the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicinal requisites and supports for the sick.
an4.60:5.4: When a noble disciple does these four things they are practicing appropriately for a layperson, which brings fame and leads to heaven.”
an4.60:6.1: “Those who are astute practice the way
an4.60:6.3: They provide those who are ethical
an4.60:6.4: and on the right path with robes,
